column2: Lily, the caretaker's daughter, did housemaid's work for them. Though their life was modest, they believed in eating well; the best of everything: diamond-bone sirloins, three-shilling tea and the best bottled stout.
column3: Lily, the caretaker's daughter, did housemaid's work for them. Though their life was modest, they believed in eating well; the best of everything: diamond bone sirloins, three shilling tea and the best bottled stout.

column2: They were fussy, that was all. But the only thing they would not stand was back answers.
column3: They were fussy, that was all. But the only thing they would not stand was back answers.

column2: And then it was long after ten o'clock and yet there was no sign of Gabriel and his wife.
column3: And then it was long after ten o'clock and yet there was no sign of Gabriel and his wife.

column2: O, Mr. Conroy, said Lily to Gabriel when she opened the door for him, "Miss Kate and Miss Julia thought you were never coming.
column3: O, mr Conroy, said Lily to Gabriel when she opened the door for him, "Miss Kate and Miss Julia thought you were never coming.

column2: Good-night, Mrs. Conroy."
Miss Kate, here's Mrs. Conroy.
Both of them kissed Gabriel's wife, said she must be perished alive, and asked was Gabriel with her.
column3: Both of them kissed Gabriel's wife, said she must be perished alive, and asked was Gabriel with her.

column2: Is it snowing again, Mr. Conroy? asked Lily.
column3: Is it snowing again, mr Conroy? asked Lily.

column2: Then he took a coin rapidly from his pocket.
column3: Then he took a coin rapidly from his pocket.

column2: Just... here's a little...."
He walked rapidly towards the door.
column3: He walked rapidly towards the door.

column2: They both kissed Gabriel frankly.
Don't mind him, Aunt Kate, she said.
column3: Don't mind him, Aunt Kate, she said.

column2: He's really an awful bother, what with green shades for Tom's eyes at night and making him do the dumb-bells, and forcing Eva to eat the stirabout.	He's really an awful bother, what with green shades for Tom's eyes at night and making him do the dumb bells, and forcing Eva to eat the stirabout.
The poor child!
Of course, you've seen about the room.	Of course, you've seen about the room.
She's not the girl she was at all."
column3: She's not the girl she was at all."

column2: Julia! Julia!
Julia, there's Miss Daly and Miss Power will take some refreshment.
column3: Julia, there's Miss Daly and Miss Power will take some refreshment.

column2: God help me, he said, smiling, "it's the doctor's orders."
column3: God help me, he said, smiling, "it's the doctor's orders."

column2: And his poor mother made him take the pledge on New Year's Eve.	And his poor mother made him take the pledge on New Year's Eve.
